00019 void vectorToPose(const Eigen::Vector3d& vec, geometry_msgs::Pose& pose)
00020 {
00021   pose.position.x = vec(0);
00022   pose.position.y = vec(1);
00023   pose.orientation.z = vec(2);
00024 }
00025 
00030 void PoseToVector(const geometry_msgs::Pose& pose, Eigen::Vector3d& vec)
00031 {
00032   vec << pose.position.x, pose.position.y, pose.orientation.z;
00033 }
00034 
00036 class MiabotStateEstimator
00037 {
00038 public:
00039   int numRobots;
00040   ros::NodeHandle n;
00041   ros::Publisher Pub_state;
00042   ros::Subscriber Sub_measure;
00043   ros::Subscriber Sub_control;
00044 private:
00045   double measureTime;
00046   double stateTime;
00047   std::vector<Eigen::Vector3d> x;
00048   std::vector<Eigen::Vector2d,Eigen::aligned_allocator<Eigen::Vector2d> > u;
00049   std::vector<Eigen::Vector3d> z;
00050   std::vector<Eigen::Matrix3d> p;
00051   std::vector<Eigen::Matrix3d> k;
00052   Eigen::Matrix3d q;
00053   Eigen::Matrix3d r;
00054   
00055 public:
00059   MiabotStateEstimator(const ros::NodeHandle& node_handle, const int numBots) :
00060       numRobots(numBots),
00061       n(node_handle), 
00062       Pub_state(),
00063       Sub_measure(),
00064       Sub_control(), 
00065       measureTime(0.0),
00066       stateTime(0.0),
00067       x(numBots),
00068       u(numBots),
00069       z(numBots),
00070       p(numBots),
00071       k(numBots),
00072       q(),
00073       r()
00074   {
00075   }
00076 
00081   void init(double* pose_list)
00082   {
00083     // create Publisher object where output will be advertised
00084     // template type in < > is the message type to be published
00085     Pub_state =  n.advertise<geometry_msgs::PoseArray>("state_estimate", 1);
00086 
00087     // create Subscriber objects to collect states and new waypoint commands
00088     Sub_control = n.subscribe("cmd_vel_array",      1,&MiabotStateEstimator::controlCallback,this);
00089     Sub_measure = n.subscribe("planar_measurements",1,&MiabotStateEstimator::measureCallback,this);
00090 
00091     // put initial conditions into weight arrays
00092     q = Matrix3d::Identity();
00093     r = Matrix3d::Identity();
00094     r(0,0) = 0.0001;
00095     r(1,1) = 0.0001;
00096     r(2,2) = 0.0005;
00097     q(0,0) = 1.0;
00098     q(1,1) = 1.0;
00099     q(2,2) = 1.0; 
00100 
00101     // put initial conditions into state, control, covariance for each robot
00102     for (int m = 0; m < numRobots; m++)
00103     {
00104       x[m] << pose_list[numRobots*m], pose_list[numRobots*m+1], pose_list[numRobots*m+2];
00105       u[m] = Vector2d::Zero();
00106       p[m] = Matrix3d::Constant(0.1);      
00107     }
00108  }
00109 
00115   void controlCallback(const dcsl_messages::TwistArray newVelocities)
00116   {
00117     if(int(newVelocities.twists.size()) == numRobots)
00118     {
00119       ROS_DEBUG_STREAM("received new control message");
00120       for (int m = 0; m < numRobots; m++) // loop through robots
00121       {
00122         u[m](0) = newVelocities.twists[m].linear.x;
00123         u[m](1) = newVelocities.twists[m].angular.z;
00124         ROS_DEBUG_STREAM("u[" << m << "] = " << u[m]);
00125       }
00126     }
00127     else
00128     {
00129       ROS_ERROR_STREAM("number of velocities did not match numRobots, skipping...");
00130     }
00131   }
00132 
00139   void measureCallback(const geometry_msgs::PoseArray newMeasurement)
00140   {
00141     if(int(newMeasurement.poses.size()) == numRobots)
00142     {
00143       ros::Time rosMeasureTime = ros::Time::now();
00144       double newMeasureTime = rosMeasureTime.toSec();
00145       
00146       geometry_msgs::PoseArray state_message;
00147       state_message.header.stamp = rosMeasureTime;
00148       geometry_msgs::Pose current_pose;
00149       for (int m = 0; m < numRobots; m++) // loop through robots
00150       {
00151         // perform propagation steps
00152         miabot_propagate_state(x[m], u[m], newMeasureTime - stateTime);
00153         miabot_propagate_covariance(p[m], x[m], u[m], q, r, newMeasureTime - measureTime);
00154 
00155         // perform update steps, only if this robot was tracked
00156         if (newMeasurement.poses[m].orientation.w == 1)
00157         {
00158           miabot_calculate_filter_gain(k[m],p[m],r);
00159           // take measurement out of message
00160           PoseToVector(newMeasurement.poses[m], z[m]);
00161           ROS_DEBUG_STREAM("new measurement in z[" << m << "] = " << std::endl << z[m]);
00162           miabot_update_state(x[m],k[m],z[m]);
00163           miabot_update_covariance(p[m],k[m]);          
00164         }
00165         else // robot was not tracked in this measurement
00166         {
00167           ROS_ERROR_STREAM("no measurement for robot " << m << ", skipping state update");
00168         }
00169         // place the updated state into the message to be published
00170         vectorToPose(x[m], current_pose);
00171         state_message.poses.push_back(current_pose);
00172       }
00173       measureTime = stateTime = newMeasureTime;
00174       Pub_state.publish(state_message);
00175     }
00176     else
00177     {
00178       ROS_ERROR_STREAM("number of measurements did not match numRobots, skipping...");
00179     }
00180   }
00181 
00187   void propagateState()
00188   {
00189     // calculate time elapsed since last estimate was published, 
00190     // propagates state forward, and publishes the result
00191     ros::Time newRosTime = ros::Time::now();
00192     double newTime = newRosTime.toSec();
00193     double dt = newTime - stateTime;
00194     stateTime = newTime;
00195 
00196     geometry_msgs::PoseArray state_message;
00197     state_message.header.stamp = newRosTime;
00198     geometry_msgs::Pose current_pose;
00199     for (int m = 0; m < numRobots; m++) // loop through robots
00200     {
00201       ROS_DEBUG_STREAM("propagating state ahead by dt = " << dt);
00202       ROS_DEBUG_STREAM("x_minus = " << x[m]);
00203       //x[m] = miabot_propagate_state(x[m], u[m], dt);
00204       miabot_propagate_state(x[m], u[m], dt);
00205       ROS_DEBUG_STREAM("x_plus  = " << x[m]);
00206       vectorToPose(x[m], current_pose);
00207       state_message.poses.push_back(current_pose);
00208     }
00209     Pub_state.publish(state_message);
00210   }
00211 };
00212 
00216 int main(int argc, char **argv)
00217 {
00218   // initialize the node, with name miabot_waypoint_control
00219   ros::init(argc, argv, "dcsl_miabot_state_estimator");
00220 
00221   // create the NodeHandle which tells ROS which node this is
00222   ros::NodeHandle n;
00223 
00224   // collect number of robots from parameter server (default 1)
00225   int numRobots;
00226   n.param<int>("/n_robots", numRobots, 1);
00227 
00228   // create the controller object
00229   MiabotStateEstimator mse(n, numRobots);
00230 
00231   // collect initial positions from parameter server (default all at (0,0))
00232   double initial_poses[numRobots*3];
00233   XmlRpc::XmlRpcValue pose_list;
00234   if (n.hasParam("initial_poses"))
00235   {
00236     n.getParam("initial_poses", pose_list);
00237     ROS_ASSERT(pose_list.getType() == XmlRpc::XmlRpcValue::TypeArray);
00238     for (int32_t i = 0; i < pose_list.size(); ++i) 
00239     {
00240       ROS_ASSERT(pose_list[i].getType() == XmlRpc::XmlRpcValue::TypeDouble);
00241       initial_poses[i] = static_cast<double>(pose_list[i]);
00242     }    
00243   }
00244   else
00245   {
00246     for (int i = 0; i < numRobots*3; i++)
00247     {
00248       initial_poses[i] = 0.0;
00249     }
00250   }
00251   // initialize the controller object
00252   mse.init(initial_poses);
00253 
00254   // loop continuously, updating state at roughly 25 hz
00255   // (the loop rate should probably be a param in launch file)
00256   ros::Rate looprate(25); // 25 hz
00257   while(ros::ok())
00258   {
00259     ros::spinOnce();
00260     mse.propagateState();
00261     looprate.sleep();
00262   }
00263 
00264   return 0;
00265 }
